Document.Focus: Leber hereditary optic neuropathy with dystonia

Synonyms.Synonym: Dystonia familial, with visual failure and striatal lucencies

QAPair.Question: What is (are) Leber hereditary optic neuropathy with dystonia ?
QAPair.Answer: Leber hereditary optic neuropathy (LHON) with dystonia is a very rare variant of LHON where an individual has LHON associated with dystonia, which involves involuntary muscle contractions, tremors, and other unctrolled movements. It is caused by mutations in one of three mitochondrial genes: MT-ND1, MT-ND3, MT-ND4, and MT-ND6. Other features that have been associated with this condition include difficulty walking, muscle wasting, scoliosis, dysphagia, dysarthria, intellectual disability, dementia, and spasticity. The dystonia usually begins in childhood; vision loss may begin in early adulthood.
